snippet: Even as Republicans vow to leverage the federal borrowing limit in their demands for spending cuts, President Obama, who signed the tax bill Wednesday, says he won’t join in more charged talks on the issue.
abstract: Republicans, in wake of resolution of fiscal crisis but bracing for fight in February, vow to leverage the federal borrowing limit in their demands for spending cuts; Pres Obama, who signed tax bill, says he will not join in more charged talks on the issue; situation sets stage again for standoff that economists warn could lead to damaging financial default and doubt from investors.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JACKIE CALMES

lead_paragraph: Even as Republicans vow to leverage the federal borrowing limit in their demands for spending cuts, President Obama, who signed the tax bill Wednesday, says he won’t join in more charged talks on the issue.

headline.seo: Debt Ceiling Clash Nears for Lawmakers
headline.main: Lawmakers Gird for Next Fiscal Clash, on the Debt Ceiling
